title: Romania‚Äôs Superior Council of Magistracy files criminal complaint against deputy PM over pension comments | Romania Insider
text: Romania‚Äôs Superior Council of Magistracy files criminal complaint against deputy PM over pension comments | Romania Insider Skip to main content 5¬∞C Bucharest, RO 19:31 Search 5¬∞C Bucharest, RO 19:31 Search SERVICES NEWSLETTER Defense Romania‚Äôs Superior Council of Magistracy files criminal complaint against deputy PM over pension comments 11 November 2025 Iulian Ernst Like this article? Share it with your friends! Facebook Twitter Google Pinterest Reddit Email LinkedIn The Superior Council of Magistracy (CSM) has filed a criminal complaint against deputy prime minister Oana Gheorghiu, accusing her of ‚Äúviolating the independence of justice and the status of magistrates in an irresponsible and populist manner,‚Äù the institution announced. The move follows Gheorghiu‚Äôs recent comments on Digi24 , calling for a reduction in magistrates‚Äô special pensions, which the CSM claims amounted to incitement to hatred and violence against members of the judiciary. The council argued that her statements undermined public confidence in the justice system and represented a form of political interference in judicial independence. During the interview, Gheorghiu said that the funds used to cover special pensions, including those for magistrates, come at the expense of other public services. ‚ÄúThe money used to pay for magistrates‚Äô and other special pensions is taken from other sources, from children, from hospitals, and those who receive them should think about where it would be appropriate to get funds to pay their high incomes,‚Äù she said. She also criticized the system that allows magistrates to benefit from large compensation awards made through court rulings by their peers. ‚ÄúThey get [this money] from somewhere, and they can take it from the mouth of a child who goes to bed hungry, from the budget of a hospital that has no medicines. This money is not printed and does not come out of thin air; it comes from somewhere. And maybe that‚Äôs what people don‚Äôt understand: that when you receive privileges, for you to have privileges, someone is left behind,‚Äù Gheorghiu stated. The complaint intensifies tensions between the judiciary and the Government as officials race to reform the special pensions system by November 28, a key deadline for unlocking EUR 870 million in suspended EU funds under the Resilience Facility. (Photo: George Calin/ Inquam Photos) iulian@romania-insider.com Read next 21 October 2025 Justice Romania's Constitutional Court finds procedural flaw with law aiming to reform magistrates' pension system Normal Defense Romania‚Äôs Superior Council of Magistracy files criminal complaint against deputy PM over pension comments 11 November 2025 Iulian Ernst Like this article? Share it with your friends!
